subject: Re: Min-box vs. RS hack
author: Lance Oliver
full_text:
Thanks for the clarification, Rosemary and April.

I just got great news! Ron's personally going to be bringing to my 
new Mini to the DAPS group meeting next Tuesday!! 

I've heard such positive feedback, from him and others, I can't wait 
to start experimenting. 

As positive communications with the Mini are established, I'll make 
sure other researchers are in the loop. 

Lance 

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "April Slaughter" <aprilrebuilt@...> 
wrote:
>
> On the specs side, the MiniBox has controls for both scan rate as 
well
> as sensitivity, so you can cut down on the amount of random noise 
and
> also find a speed which seems clearer, whereas you cannot with the 
RS
> Hack (as far as I know). The rechargeable battery lasts about 40-50
> hours on one charge... nothing to replace that way. It has both a
> speaker output and one for a recorder so you can not only hear it as
> loud as you like, but you can directly record your session from the 
box.  
> 
> When it comes to audible differences, the quality of the electronics
> used provides clearer sound. I am not straining so much to hear
> things. It is just speculation on my part, but it seems to take less
> time and less effort for communication from the other side to come
> through with the Mini. At least, in my experiences with both 
devices.
> Though, I have gotten snippets from the RS Hack that were 
impressive.
> 
> ~April 
>
